meanings.definition: The act of bestowing or giving something
meanings.sent1: The bestowal of kindness upon others is a noble gesture.
meanings.sent2: The bestowal of a scholarship brought joy to the student.
meanings.sent3: The bestowal of a crown upon a cat would be quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her bestowal of wisdom upon the young minds was like a beacon in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The bestowal of a magical wand made her the most powerful wizard in the land.

meanings.definition: The act of presenting a gift or honor
meanings.sent1: The bestowal of a medal marked his bravery in battle.
meanings.sent2: The bestowal of flowers upon her was a gesture of love.
meanings.sent3: The bestowal of a golden trophy to a penguin would be quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The bestowal of a crown upon her head made her feel like a queen.
meanings.sent5: The bestowal of a star named after her was a celestial honor.

meanings.definition: The act of granting or conferring something
meanings.sent1: The bestowal of a title upon him elevated his status.
meanings.sent2: The bestowal of permission allowed them to proceed.
meanings.sent3: The bestowal of a superhero cape to a squirrel would be quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The bestowal of forgiveness upon her healed old wounds.
meanings.sent5: The bestowal of a key unlocked the mysteries of the ancient chest.
